comments.body: Do we need huge chunks of whitespace?
This probably belongs at the same place as copyDirectory.

comments.body: I would be happier if updatePath just had an `| isWindows` check as we do elsewhere in this module, and call a separate module to manage the windows PATH (`DAML.Assistant.Install.Win32`) with all the conditional compilation there.
I’ll move it to `DAML.Assistant.Install.Path`. Having a module called `Win32` that also contains the logic used outside of Windows seems weird.

comments.body: In the (very) corner case of having no Path you end up with a redundant trailing `;`. Could we append to the list then intercalate at the end?

diffHunk:
@@ -173,10 +184,44 @@ activateDaml env@InstallEnv{..} targetPath = do
                      ]
             else createSymbolicLink damlBinarySourcePath damlBinaryTargetPath
 
-    unlessQuiet env $ do -- Ask user to add .daml/bin to PATH if it is absent.
-        searchPaths <- map dropTrailingPathSeparator <$> getSearchPath
-        when (damlBinaryTargetDir `notElem` searchPaths) $ do
-            output ("Please add " <> damlBinaryTargetDir <> " to your PATH.")
+    updatePath env damlBinaryTargetDir
+
+updatePath :: InstallEnv -> FilePath -> IO ()
+#ifdef mingw32_HOST_OS
+updatePath env@InstallEnv{..} targetPath = do
+    -- Updating PATH on Windows is annoying so we do it automatically.
+    bracket (regOpenKeyEx hKEY_CURRENT_USER "Environment" kEY_ALL_ACCESS) regCloseKey $ \envKey -> do
+        path <- regQueryValueEx envKey "Path"
+        let newPath = targetPath <> ";" <> remove targetPath path
+        regSetStringValue envKey "Path" newPath
+    unlessQuiet env $
+        output (targetPath <> " has been added to your PATH. Reboot for the changes to take effect.")
+    where
+        -- Given a comma separated string, remove any occurences of a given string.
+        remove :: String -> String -> String
+        remove x = intercalate ";" . filter (/= x) . split (== ';')
+
+-- | Win32 does expose function of the same name but it requires you to know the
+-- size of the value in advance which makes it quite annoying to use.
+regQueryValueEx :: HKEY -> String -> IO String

comments.body: Could we have this check on both branches? If the user has rejigged their path to put DAML at the end for some reason, its impolite to move it to the start.

diffHunk:
@@ -173,10 +184,44 @@ activateDaml env@InstallEnv{..} targetPath = do
                      ]
             else createSymbolicLink damlBinarySourcePath damlBinaryTargetPath
 
-    unlessQuiet env $ do -- Ask user to add .daml/bin to PATH if it is absent.
-        searchPaths <- map dropTrailingPathSeparator <$> getSearchPath
-        when (damlBinaryTargetDir `notElem` searchPaths) $ do
-            output ("Please add " <> damlBinaryTargetDir <> " to your PATH.")
+    updatePath env damlBinaryTargetDir
+
+updatePath :: InstallEnv -> FilePath -> IO ()
+#ifdef mingw32_HOST_OS
+updatePath env@InstallEnv{..} targetPath = do
+    -- Updating PATH on Windows is annoying so we do it automatically.
+    bracket (regOpenKeyEx hKEY_CURRENT_USER "Environment" kEY_ALL_ACCESS) regCloseKey $ \envKey -> do
+        path <- regQueryValueEx envKey "Path"
+        let newPath = targetPath <> ";" <> remove targetPath path
+        regSetStringValue envKey "Path" newPath
+    unlessQuiet env $
+        output (targetPath <> " has been added to your PATH. Reboot for the changes to take effect.")
+    where
+        -- Given a comma separated string, remove any occurences of a given string.
+        remove :: String -> String -> String
+        remove x = intercalate ";" . filter (/= x) . split (== ';')
+
+-- | Win32 does expose function of the same name but it requires you to know the
+-- size of the value in advance which makes it quite annoying to use.
+regQueryValueEx :: HKEY -> String -> IO String
+regQueryValueEx key valueName =
+    withForeignPtr key $ \p_key ->
+    withTString valueName $ \c_valueName ->
+    alloca $ \p_valueLen -> do
+        failUnlessSuccess "regQueryDefaultValue" $
+            c_RegQueryValueEx p_key c_valueName nullPtr nullPtr nullPtr p_valueLen
+        valueLen <- peek p_valueLen
+        allocaArray0 (fromIntegral valueLen) $ \ c_value -> do
+            failUnlessSuccess "regQueryDefaultValue" $
+                c_RegQueryValueEx p_key c_valueName nullPtr nullPtr c_value p_valueLen
+            peekTString (castPtr c_value)
+#else
+updatePath env@InstallEnv{..} targetPath = unlessQuiet env $ do
+    -- Ask user to add .daml/bin to PATH if it is absent.
+    searchPaths <- map dropTrailingPathSeparator <$> getSearchPath
+    when (targetPath `notElem` searchPaths) $ do

comments.body: Why not `output :: (String -> IO ())`? Restricting it to a handle is still pretty restrictive.

comments.body: Should we first remove the directory if we are doing a force install? It seems unintuitive to keep files from a previous installation if they do not exist in the new installation.
They are removed a bit further down.

comments.body:
```suggestion
    InstallChannel ch@(Custom _) -> "channel " <> pack (show ch)
```
Worh being explicit imho so we get a warning if we add more constructors (you could also consider changing the formatting but that’s probably not important).
